snippet: The leader, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, said he had rebuffed the request from American ambassador Anne W. Patterson who asked him to hold off “for a day or two” before ousting the freely elected president, Mohamed Morsi.
abstract: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, former general who is poised to be elected Egypt's next president, confirms in interview that American officials had asked him to delay the ouster of freely elected president Mohamed Morsi of the Muslim Brotherhood, request that Sisi rebuffed.
lead_paragraph: The leader, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, said he had rebuffed the request from American ambassador Anne W. Patterson who asked him to hold off “for a day or two” before ousting the freely elected president, Mohamed Morsi.

headline.main: U.S. Sought Delay of Morsi’s Ouster, Egyptian Leader Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sought Delay of Morsi’s Ouster, Egyptian Leader Says

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
